etymologies: late Middle English (in the sense ‘able to be parted’): from late Latin partibilis, from Latin partiri ‘divide into parts’

definitions: involving or denoting a system of inheritance in which a deceased person's estate is divided equally among the heirs

examples.text: the entire family lost status as a consequence of partible inheritance

shortDefinitions: involving or denoting system of inheritance in which deceased person's estate is divided equally among heirs
